org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.bufferprovider

Interface BufferProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DiscardBufferPool, InputChannel, InputGate, LocalBufferPool, RuntimeEnvironment

    public interface BufferProvider

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  BufferProvider.BufferAvailabilityRegistration 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBufferSize()
      Returns the size of buffers (in bytes) available at this buffer provider.
      BufferProvider.BufferAvailabilityRegistration registerBufferAvailabilityListener(BufferAvailabilityListener listener)
      Registers the given BufferAvailabilityListener with an empty buffer pool.
      void reportAsynchronousEvent()
      Reports an asynchronous event and interrupts each blocking method of this buffer provider in order to allow the blocked thread to respond to the event.
      Buffer requestBuffer(int minBufferSize)
      Requests a buffer with a minimum size of minBufferSize.
      Buffer requestBufferBlocking(int minBufferSize)
      Requests a buffer with a minimum size of minBufferSize.

    • Method Detail

      • requestBuffer

        Buffer requestBuffer(int minBufferSize)
              throws IOException
        Requests a buffer with a minimum size of minBufferSize. The method returns immediately, even if the request could not be fulfilled.
        Parameters:
        minBufferSize - minimum size of the requested buffer (in bytes)
        Returns:
        buffer with at least the requested size or null if no such buffer is currently available
        Throws:
        IOException

      • requestBufferBlocking

        Buffer requestBufferBlocking(int minBufferSize)
                      throws IOException,
                             InterruptedException
        Requests a buffer with a minimum size of minBufferSize. The method blocks until the request has been fulfilled or reportAsynchronousEvent() has been called.
        Parameters:
        minBufferSize - minimum size of the requested buffer (in bytes)
        Returns:
        buffer with at least the requested size
        Throws:
        IOException
        InterruptedException

      • getBufferSize

        int getBufferSize()
        Returns the size of buffers (in bytes) available at this buffer provider.
        Returns:
        size of buffers (in bytes) available at this buffer provider

      • reportAsynchronousEvent

        void reportAsynchronousEvent()
        Reports an asynchronous event and interrupts each blocking method of this buffer provider in order to allow the blocked thread to respond to the event.

      • registerBufferAvailabilityListener

        BufferProvider.BufferAvailabilityRegistration registerBufferAvailabilityListener(BufferAvailabilityListener listener)
        Registers the given BufferAvailabilityListener with an empty buffer pool.

        The registration only succeeds, if the buffer pool is empty and has not been destroyed yet.

        The registered listener will receive a notification when at least one buffer has become available again. After the notification, the listener will be unregistered.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be registered
        Returns:
        true if the registration has been successful; false if the registration failed, because the buffer pool was not empty or has already been destroyed
